intro: Galium harcynicum, commonly known as Harcyn's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium harcynicum is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a herbaceous perennial.
